Other endeavors

Brady has been featured as a guest star on several popular television programs, hosting Saturday Night Live in 2005 [ 564 ] and voicing himself in the 2005 The Simpsons episode " Homer and Ned's Hail Mary Pass " and the 2006 Family Guy episode " Patriot Games "; both football-themed episodes were broadcast within a week of that year's Super Bowl. [ 565 ] [ 566 ] In 2009, Brady appeared as himself in a sixth season episode of Entourage . [ 567 ] In 2015, Brady had cameo appearances as fictionalized versions of himself in the Entourage movie [ 568 ] and Ted 2 . [ 569 ]

In 2007, Brady was a model for the Stetson cologne . [ 570 ] He has endorsed brands including Uggs , Under Armour , Movado , Aston Martin and Glaceau Smartwater . According to Forbes , Brady earned about $7 million from endorsements in 2014. [ 571 ] [ 572 ] In 2016, he began appearing in a Beautyrest Black commercial campaign for Simmons Bedding Company . [ 573 ] That same year, Brady launched his own line of vegan snacks. [ 574 ]

On January 20, 2016, Brady announced the launch of his peak performance website TB12Sports.com. The site features Brady's training regimen information and includes a store to purchase TB12 equipment and merchandise. [ 575 ] On August 23, 2016, the TB12 brand expanded to offer a snack line. [ 576 ] The following month, Brady, alongside Boston Private and Robert Paul Properties, announced the formation of the TB12 Foundation, a nonprofit to provide free post-injury rehabilitation care and training to underprivileged young athletes. [ 577 ] In March 2017, Brady partnered with meal-kit startup Purple Carrot to offer TB12 Performance Meals. The meals utilize whole foods and focus on providing nutrients for workout recovery. [ 578 ] [ 579 ] On September 19, 2017, Simon & Schuster published Brady's first book The TB12 Method: How to Achieve a Lifetime of Sustained Peak Performance . Within 48 hours, it had become a number one best-seller on Amazon.com . [ 580 ] The book also reached No. 1 on The New York Times' weekly Best Sellers list . [ 581 ]

Filmmaker Gotham Chopra filmed Brady during the 2017 off-season and regular season for a Facebook Watch documentary series entitled Tom vs Time . According to The New York Times , the documentary follows Brady as he "conducts his ongoing subversion campaign against the actuarial tables of quarterback longevity." [ 582 ] He launched a production company, 199 Productions, in 2020. [ 583 ]

In 2021, Brady and Richard Rosenblatt co-founded a sports-based NFT platform called Autograph . [ 584 ] Autograph reached a deal with DraftKings for exclusive distribution on Autograph's sports products, creating the DraftKings Marketplace. [ 585 ] In January 2021, Autograph announced it raised $170M in funding led by Andreessen Horowitz and Kleiner Perkins . [ 586 ] In 2023, the company announced layoffs for nearly a third of its workforce. [ 587 ]

Also in 2021, Brady, among other high-profile athletes and celebrities, was a paid spokesperson for FTX , a cryptocurrency exchange. In November 2022, FTX filed for bankruptcy , wiping out billions of dollars in customer funds and Brady's stake in the company. He, alongside other spokespeople, is currently being sued for promoting unregistered securities through a class-action lawsuit . [ 588 ] [ 589 ] [ 590 ] In February 2022, the U.S. 11th Circuit Court of Appeals ruled in a lawsuit against Bitconnect that the Securities Act of 1933 extends to targeted solicitation using social media . [ 591 ] In 2023, it was reported Tom Brady owned 1,144,861 common shares in FTX, and he and his wife lost an estimated combined value of $45 million when FTX went bankrupt. [ 592 ]

Brady has participated in The Match — an exhibition and charity golf event featuring professional golfers and other athletes—in 2020, 2021, and 2022. [ 593 ] [ 594 ] [ 595 ]

In 2022, Netflix announced that Brady would be featured in a series of upcoming specials called "Greatest Roasts of All Time: GROAT." Brady is the executive producer of the series. [ 596 ] The special was titled, The Roast of Tom Brady and aired on Netflix live on May 5, 2024. [ 597 ] The event drew two million live viewers and was the sixth most-watched Netflix show that week despite only being available for less than half a day by week's end. [ 598 ]

On March 23, 2023, Brady purchased a minority stake in the Las Vegas Aces of the WNBA from the team's majority owner Mark Davis . The same year, the Aces went on to win the WNBA Championship . [ 599 ] On August 3, 2023, he became a minority owner and chairman of a new advisory board at English club Birmingham City , in partnership with Knighthead Capital Management LLC. [ 600 ]

On September 6, 2023, it was announced that Delta Air Lines had hired Brady as a strategic advisor. [ 601 ] In January 2024, Brady agreed to merge his health and apparel brands with NoBull and to become its second largest shareholder. [ 602 ] [ 603 ]

Personal life

Religious beliefs

Brady was raised as Catholic , but in a 2015 interview with The New York Times , expressed he was less religious than he is spiritual . [ 604 ] Brady stated, "I don't know what I believe. I think there's a belief system, I'm just not sure what it is." [ 605 ]

Relationships and marriages

Brady dated actress Bridget Moynahan from 2004 until late 2006. [ 606 ] Brady and Moynahan ended their relationship in early December 2006, around the time Moynahan became pregnant. [ 607 ] On February 18, 2007, Moynahan confirmed to People magazine that she was more than three months pregnant with Brady's child. [ 606 ] Their son, John Edward Thomas "Jack" Moynahan, [ 608 ] was born in August 2007. [ 609 ]

Brady began dating Brazilian model Gisele Bündchen in December 2006. [ 610 ] [ 611 ] Brady and Bündchen married on February 26, 2009, in a Catholic ceremony at St. Monica Catholic Church in Santa Monica, California. [ 612 ] Together, they have two children: a son, Benjamin Rein Brady, born in December 2009, [ 613 ] and a daughter, Vivian Lake Brady, born in December 2012. [ 614 ]

In October 2022, the couple announced on Instagram that they had finalized a divorce. [ 615 ] Brady and Bündchen's marriage had been the subject of various tabloid rumors and speculation earlier in the year after Brady came out of retirement and Bündchen voiced her concern about the effect of the violent nature of football on Brady's long-term health. [ 616 ]

Residences

Brady and his family previously resided in the Boston suburb of Brookline, Massachusetts during his playing career with the Patriots, as well as New York City. [ 617 ] They own several homes together and spend time during the summer at the Yellowstone Club near Big Sky, Montana , and at their home at Silo Ridge in Amenia, New York . [ 618 ] [ 619 ] When Brady signed with the Buccaneers, he rented a mansion in Tampa, Florida , owned by retired baseball player and former Miami Marlins owner Derek Jeter . [ 620 ] In December 2020, Brady and Bündchen reportedly bought a home in Indian Creek, Florida . [ 621 ]

Extended family

Brady and baseball player Kevin Youkilis became brothers-in-law in 2012 when Youkilis married Brady's sister Julie. [ 622 ] Brady's niece, Maya Brady , is a college softball player for the UCLA Bruins . [ 623 ] Brady is also a distant cousin of former MLB pitcher and left fielder Pete Meegan . [ 624 ]

Politics

Brady attended the 2004 State of the Union Address as a special guest of then-President George W. Bush . [ 625 ] Brady told ESPN The Magazine in 2004 that being a U.S. Senator would be his "craziest ambition." [ 626 ] [ 627 ]

Brady is a friend of former President Donald Trump . [ 628 ] [ 629 ] [ 630 ] At a political event in New Hampshire on the day before the 2016 presidential election , Trump said he had received a call from Brady, and that Brady told him: "Donald, I support you, you're my friend, and I voted for you." However, after his wife was asked directly on Instagram whether she and Brady backed Trump, Bündchen answered "NO!" [ 631 ] After a Trump campaign " Make America Great Again " cap was photographed in Brady's locker, Brady said that Bündchen told him to not discuss politics anymore, which he thought was a "good decision." [ 632 ] Brady did not join the New England Patriots in visiting Trump at the White House in April 2017 after their Super Bowl victory, citing "personal family matters." [ 633 ]

In an interview with Howard Stern on The Howard Stern Show in April 2020, Brady explained that Trump had reached out to him to speak at the 2016 Republican National Convention , and that he declined, saying, "It was uncomfortable for me because you can't undo things, not that I would undo a friendship, but political support is totally different than the support of a friend." Brady said that he has known Trump since 2001 and that Trump asked him to be a judge in the Miss USA pageant, after Brady led the Patriots to victory in Super Bowl XXXVI . Brady explained that Trump used to come to Patriots games and would call him and golf with him occasionally. However, Brady said that he did not see the benefit of getting involved in an event as polarizing as a presidential election. [ 634 ] Brady reiterated in 2022 that he had not spoken with Trump in "years" and that his relationship with Trump had been mischaracterized by the media. [ 635 ]

While there has been speculation that Brady would run for political office, [ 636 ] in a 2015 interview he stated he had no interest in doing so. [ 637 ] [ 638 ] [ 639 ] Brady reiterated in 2022 that he would avoid a political career because, "I don't think anyone's fond of politics these days." [ 635 ]

In 2018 , Brady endorsed Republican Helen Brady (no relation) for State Auditor of Massachusetts. [ 640 ] [ 641 ] [ 642 ]

Diet and lifestyle

Brady's health regimen includes transcendental meditation , yoga, hydrating, an 80/20 diet (meaning 80% alkaline and 20% acidic ), early bedtime, resistance training, and neuroplasticity training. [ 643 ]

Brady and his family adhere to his controversial, strict diet, the TB12 Method. [ 644 ] Brady advocates a daily water intake in ounces of half of one's body weight in pounds and personally consumes "a couple hundred ounces" daily. [ 645 ] [ 646 ] He avoids most fruits, mushrooms, tomatoes, peppers, eggplants, coffee, Gatorade , white sugar, flour, gluten, dairy, soda, cereal, white rice, potatoes, and bread. [ 647 ] [ 648 ] In 2022, Brady said he prefers a diet consisting of organic food , saying, "You've got to see the process of food being grown [...] If I need nutrients, I need that from soil." [ 635 ]

One of Brady's friends and former teammates, tight end Rob Gronkowski, has followed Brady and Alex Guerrero 's plant-based diet plan since 2017. [ 649 ] [ 650 ] Other professional athletes who follow Brady's diet include quarterback Kirk Cousins [ 651 ] and hockey player Mark Scheifele . [ 652 ] [ 653 ]
